oust.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to force someone out of a position of power, especially so that you can take their place
oust.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The Communists were finally ousted from power.
oust.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to force someone to leave a job or important position
oust.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Profit margins collapsed and Martinez was ousted as chairman.
two top executives who had been ousted from the board
oust.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: if one company or product ousts another from its market position, it becomes more successful
oust.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Cotton eventually ousted wool from its dominant role in clothing production.
